title.narrative: TCE Total Control of the Epidemic

description.narrative: Contacting each and every family in a specific area of 100 villages with 500,000 people, systematically reaching, inspiring and mobilizing people to fight and stop the disease (HIV/AIDS). The projects have concentrated on identifying, referring and testing people at risk. TCE Jodhpur is working on the line of classic TCE projects but fighting against Diabetes in the rural areas of Western Rajasthan. The link workers are called field officer as per the TCE model. They are 40 of them to reach 100 villages where a pair of two one male and one female reaches five villages with a population of 25,000 people in the area. The idea further is to bridge the gap between the Government health services and the high risk and vulnerable community. The principle of Trio’s operate here i.e., one HIV positive individual with a kith or kin, and our field officer or link worker forms a trio. It supports the individual in the fight against stigma and discrimination, adherence to ARV and thus leading a healthy life.
Groups at risk for HIV Female Sex Workers, Truckers, Migrant workers, Intravenous Drug Users

Key activities of the HIV/AIDS Projects:-
Reaching people: The projects reached the high-risk groups and vulnerable people in the operational areas with information about HIV/AIDS, Sexually Transmitted Infections, condom promotion and safe sex.
Behavior Change Communication: The Field Officers of the TCE project and Outreach Workers and Peer Educators of the Hope projects reached households of the project operational areas to conduct one-to-one and group meetings with various target groups to modify their risky behavior and replace them with safe sex practices.
Condom promotion: Condom demonstration and distribution activities were implemented through community events, health camps, personal and group interactions in the field and in health clinics.
HIV counseling and testing: The TCE Narela project has performed field-level HIV counseling and testing with the involvement of its Field Officers. The rest of the projects referred people to ICTCs (Integrated Counseling & Testing Centre) after field- and clinic-level counseling.
Managing Sexually Transmitted Infections: The health clinics of the Targeted Intervention (TI) projects of HPPI have provided clinical management of Sexually Transmitted Infections (STIs) to female sex workers along with services like presumptive treatment, STI is screening and syphilis screening. The rest of the projects where there were no facilities of clinical services referred people suffering from symptoms of STI to Government hospitals or medical colleges for medical management along with the necessary follow-up.
Training of the project staff and peer educators: HPPI has provided professional training to its project staff and peer educators in collaboration with its partners.
